Class MainMenuHandlingSettings

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.mainMenu.MainMenuHandlingSettings
public class MainMenuHandlingSettings extends Object
Data holder and UI helper for gameplay handling settings used by the main menu.

Fields represent commonly-tunable values (auto-repeat rate, DAS/DCD, speed drop factor, and whether hard-drop is enabled). Fields are public to allow simple copy/assign semantics when loading/saving preferences.

The showHandlingControls helper builds and displays an overlay that allows the user to edit these values. The helper adds the overlay to the provided rootStack and hides/restores the settingsOptions pane; it returns the chosen values through the onSave callback.

Threading & side-effects: - The method performs JavaFX UI operations and uses Platform.runLater for scene-dependent bindings; callers should invoke it from the FX thread or accept that the helper will schedule UI work. - The method writes to the scene graph (adds/removes nodes) and therefore may throw runtime exceptions in restricted environments; it swallows many exceptions to remain resilient but does print stack traces on unexpected errors.

  • Method Details

    • showHandlingControls

      public void showHandlingControls(ClassLoader loaderClassLoader, int arrMs, int dasMs, int dcdMs, double sdf, boolean hardDropEnabled, javafx.scene.layout.StackPane rootStack, javafx.scene.layout.StackPane settingsOptions, Consumer<MainMenuHandlingSettings> onSave, BiConsumer<javafx.scene.layout.StackPane,Runnable> closeOverlayCaller, Consumer<javafx.scene.layout.StackPane> transitionCaller)
      Display the handling settings overlay and invoke onSave when the user presses Save.
      Parameters:
      loaderClassLoader - class loader used to locate FXML/resources
      arrMs - initial auto-repeat rate (ms)
      dasMs - initial DAS (ms)
      dcdMs - initial DCD (ms)
      sdf - initial soft-drop factor (multiplier)
      hardDropEnabled - initial hard-drop enabled flag
      rootStack - root StackPane where the overlay will be added
      settingsOptions - the settings pane to hide while the overlay is shown
      onSave - callback invoked with chosen settings when Save is pressed (may be null)
      closeOverlayCaller - function used to close the overlay with an animation: (overlay, onFinished)
      transitionCaller - function used to run the opening transition for the overlay: (overlay)
